SENT.plain: Acute iatrogenic flow-limiting dissection, a feared complication, developed in the tortuous cervical internal carotid artery (ICA) of a 35-year-old man during endovascular treatment of a growing left middle cerebral artery fusiform aneurysm
While attempting true lumen penetration, the guidewire perforated the dissection flap, regaining the true lumen
We fenestrated the intimal flap with a balloon and navigated a microcatheter through it in order to perform the intracranial embolization procedure
After aneurysm embolization, several stents were implanted for ICA restoration
